summary: Git is a distributed revision control system. A vulnerability in Git allows a local attacker to execute arbitrary code when cloning a repository. This is caused by an integer overflow in the way Git handles large pack files. The vulnerability is patched in versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4.
details: Git is a distributed revision control system. A vulnerability in Git allows a local attacker to execute arbitrary code when cloning a repository. This is caused by an integer overflow in the way Git handles large pack files. The vulnerability is patched in versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4.

summary: A vulnerability in Git allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on a victim's machine. This is caused by a flaw in the way Git handles submodules. An attacker can create a malicious repository that, when cloned, will execute a script on the victim's machine. The vulnerability is patched in versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4.
details: A vulnerability in Git allows a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on a victim's machine. This is caused by a flaw in the way Git handles submodules. An attacker can create a malicious repository that, when cloned, will execute a script on the victim's machine. The vulnerability is patched in versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4.

summary: A vulnerability in Git's handling of symbolic links can lead to remote code execution. An attacker can create a malicious repository that, when cloned, will create a symbolic link to a sensitive file on the victim's machine. The vulnerability is patched in versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4.
details: A vulnerability in Git's handling of symbolic links can lead to remote code execution. An attacker can create a malicious repository that, when cloned, will create a symbolic link to a sensitive file on the victim's machine. The vulnerability is patched in versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4.

summary: A vulnerability in Git allows a local attacker to execute arbitrary code. This is caused by a flaw in the way Git handles the `git apply --reject` command. An attacker can create a malicious patch that, when applied, will create a file with arbitrary content in an arbitrary location on the filesystem. The vulnerability is patched in versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4.
details: A vulnerability in Git allows a local attacker to execute arbitrary code. This is caused by a flaw in the way Git handles the `git apply --reject` command. An attacker can create a malicious patch that, when applied, will create a file with arbitrary content in an arbitrary location on the filesystem. The vulnerability is patched in versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4.

summary: A vulnerability in Git allows a local attacker to execute arbitrary code. This is caused by a flaw in the way Git handles the `git apply` command with the `--3way` option. An attacker can create a malicious patch that, when applied, will create a file with arbitrary content in an arbitrary location on the filesystem. The vulnerability is patched in versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4.
details: A vulnerability in Git allows a local attacker to execute arbitrary code. This is caused by a flaw in the way Git handles the `git apply` command with the `--3way` option. An attacker can create a malicious patch that, when applied, will create a file with arbitrary content in an arbitrary location on the filesystem. The vulnerability is patched in versions 2.45.1, 2.44.1, 2.43.4, 2.42.2, 2.41.1, 2.40.2, and 2.39.4.
